title: Print elements of an array
contentHtml:
Write a program to print elements of an array

Input  : [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
Output : 1 2 3 4 5

# include <stdio.h>

// Prints int array
void PrintArray(int *array)
{
	int len = sizeof(array);
	for (int i = 0; i < len; ++i)
	{
		printf("%d\n", array[i]);
	}
}

void main()
{
	int array[] = {1, 2, 3, 4};
	PrintArray(array);
}

#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
int main(){
    int n;cin>>n;
    vector<int> v(n);
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++) cin>>v[i];
    for(int i=0;i<n;i++) cout<<v[i]<<" ";
    cout<<'\n';
    return 0;
}

// Contributed by Raghav Garg

using System;
public class Example
{
    public static void Main()
    {
        int[] array = { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 };
        foreach (int i in array) {
            Console.Write("{0} ", i);
        }
    }
}

public class PrintElementsOfAnArray {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int [] arr = {1,2,3,4,5};
        printArrayElements(arr);
    }
    static void printArrayElements(int [] nums){
        for(int element: nums){
            System.out.print(element + " ");
        }
    }
}

let array = [1,2,3,4,5];
console.log(...array);


// here ... is spread operator

def printArrayElements array
    puts array.join(" ")
end

printArrayElements [1,2,3,4,5]

function printElementsOfAnArray(array: any[]): void {
    console.log(...array)
}

printElementsOfAnArray(['1', '2', '3', '4'])

arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

for num in arr:
    print(num, end=" ")

object printArray {
    def main(args:Array[String]):Unit={
        val nums: List[Int] = List(1, 2, 3, 4, 5); 
        for ( i <- 0 to (nums.length - 1)) {
         print(nums{i});
        }
    }
}

void main(List<String> args) {
  List<dynamic> list = [1, "2", false, 3.5];
  print(list);
}

package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
	arr := [5]int{1, 2, 3, 4, 5}
	fmt.Println(arr)
}

<?php

function printElements($arr) {
  foreach($arr as $item){
    echo $item . "\n";
}
}

printElements([1,2,3,4,5])

?>

@num = (1, 2, 3, 4, 5);
print "@num\n";

fn main() {
    let arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];

    for i in 0..arr.len() {
        println!("{}", arr[i]);
    }
}
